name: Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Biloxi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hubby and I have stayed at Beau Rivage many times, Grand, and now Hard Rock. We always thought the Beau was the place, but absolutely love the Hard Rock. Regular rooms are great with good feng shui and great showers etc. One we were able to score and upgrade for free (our room was comped anyway), and it was the most glorious suite we stayed in. Corner of floor with attached glassed in area with jacuzzi and makeup counter right on the gulf. Connected to a huge rainforest show ( about 8x8) and into another bath area with separate toilet area. Also there was a half bath off the living room as you entered. The bed was even more heavenly than the normal beds there! All floor to ceiling glass on entire suite. Will never forget it! Also want to mention that I asked for upgrade when checking in (platinum member) and was very abruptly told by someone on phone that it was not possible. OK....finally accepted normal room and headed to players club to get new card. Forgot mine. When they asked if I was enjoying our stay, I said yes, but muttered something about rude guy on phone. Went back to old room two hours later and phone did not work. Went to frt desk, and they said our room had been changed. Got hubby to help move a few things and head to different room . Opened the door to paradise. WILL NEVER FORGET IT! You can always politely ask. BTW, I amnot a high roller.
reviews.title: Uber cool for Biloxi

likes.liked: — The mood is younger and very congenial....nut stuffy.
likes.disliked: — When a staff member forgets who is the customer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night on our way to hop on a cruise in Mobile, AL. The hotel was great. Awesome rooms, comfortable beds and the people who worked there were very nice. Everything is very modern and clean. The room really looked like a room in a spa. I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Awesome place!
Great Time
reviews.text: Highlights: Comfy beds, shower with 3 heads, including one in the ceiling, nice view of the Gulf of Mexico.
People were warm and freindly,waited only minutes to check in.
reviews.title: Trace tramps had a blast at the Hard Rock!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were larger then expected. Loved the 3 headed shower.
reviews.title: Hard Rock is figuring it out!!!

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in Feb 2008. Overall, found the hotel to be excellent, with nice ammenities. It is true the front desk is somewhat staffed with youngsters, but they get the job done(eventually).
reviews.title: Excellent first stay

reviews.text: The hotel room is well appointed, and very comfortable. In fact, probably my favorite hotel room ever. The TV is quite nice, and I can't say enough good things about the shower.
reviews.title: This place is run by kids!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ate at the buffet, which is good for the price. Ruth's Chris is good as always. The Hard Rock Cafe, is standard meaning slow service and subpar food.
reviews.title: Worst experience, ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All I can say is, "WOW!!!" We chose to stay at the Hard Rock because they were the only "pet friendly" hotel & casino in Biloxi. What a great stroke of luck! From the moment we arrived, everyone was extremely helpful. Since our room wasn't ready yet (couldn't check in until 3) and we wanted to play in a poker tournament, they helped us find accommodations for our dog.
reviews.title: OMG, the Hard Rock blew me away!!!

likes.liked: — The bed - where can I get one?!

reviews.text: When our room was ready, we went upstairs and could not believe it. We both travel a good bit, and this was probably the most luxurious "standard" room we've stayed in. We've stayed in suites that couldn't compare!
reviews.title: If I was 15 years younger...

reviews.text: We both enjoyed the casino but especially enjoyed the buffet. They had a phenomenal selection of food - everything from sushi and crawfish to pasta and salads. I wish they had fresh-brewed sweet tea rather than the junk out of the soda fountain, but I digress. The food more than made up for it and I suffered with a soda. ;-)
reviews.title: This place ROCKS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When the Hard Rock says that they have "sleep like a rock" beds, they mean it! When I was all tuckered out from a long night of gambling, I melted into the bed and didn't want to ever come back out!!! The whirlpool tub was a nice touch, made even nicer by the Aveda toiletries. When I realized I had forgotten my toiletry bag and called downstairs for a comb and extra shampoo, they delivered a full-sized plastic shopping bag of toiletries, a sewing kit, brush, comb, toothbrushes - the works.
reviews.title: Hard Rock Hotel ROCKS!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I were both hoping we'd hit it big in the casino so that we could just buy a room. Neither one of us wanted to come home. I think my only caveat was that the view was so spectacular (floor to ceiling windows), my dog was terrified to go within 5 feet of the windows for fear of falling out. LOL
reviews.title: Trendy in Biloxi

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When it opened after Katrina ,I said the Hard Rock Hotel ,Biloxi was the best hotel I ever stayed in..Not condos ,but hotels it was the nicest...and we stayed in lots of hotels around the country.But about one year later the Hard Rock needs to be maintained.Our room's air conditioner barely cooled,it might have just needed an air filter.The coffee maker did not work,the shower door had to be pulled very,very hard to open,the mini bar had a rip inside the door,the book with the hotel details had the pages ripped out the binder,and the room was not very clean.For $200.00 a night ,it 's not worth it any more.They should do better.How do you let a great hotel like this fall in disrepair?
reviews.title: Needs Maintenence
Hard Rock Hotel-PERFECT!!!
reviews.text: My family of 4 took a late vacation in August to New Orleans, continued to Biloxi MS, and ended in Vicksburg, MS. Our stay in Biloxi was excellent because the Hard Rock Hotel was our destination. Let me give you some examples:

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The Gulfport Department of Tourism arranged our reservation so when we arrived a 50.00 gas card was waiting for us. Great way to start the trip.
reviews.title: A Fun Hotel with a New Twist in Style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The room was big, modern, and everyone talks about the 2-headed shower, it was cool. HI Def TV doesn't hurt.
reviews.title: Thumbs up for the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. We went to the pool and hung out there the majority of our stay. The swim up bar is fun and convienent and I would recommend spending the extra 60.00 to rent one of the cabanas. Cheap price and it includes a fruit tray and water plus it gives you a place to hang out throughout the day.
reviews.title: I'll come back to Biloxi just for The Hard Rock!

aka: Hard Rock Hotel And Casino Biloxi
description: Hard Rock Hotel & Casino Biloxi is a striking 12-story purple and white hotel tower announced by the world's largest Hard Rock Guitar sign. With its modern design, Hard Rock Biloxi boast high cellings, an open casino floor, a sleek nightclub and boutique rooms with walk-in showers. Located in the heart of the Mississippi Gulf Coast, guest can easily access the beach as well as take in spectacular views of the Gulf of Mexico.
